photo-caption:
Man oh man. I’ve been trying to run this play for YEARS, and I might finally have pulled it off.

  1. Give the Romans open borders so that they can wander through my lands and conquer (most of) the Celtic cities: in this case, two out of three: Cardiff and Edinburgh (which you can just see at the left edge of the map).
  2. Take away open borders so that it becomes harder for them to reinforce those cities.
  3. Wait until the Romans are distracted with a war against a larger enemy (in this case, the Japanese, whose white-coloured lands you can see on the minimap).
  4. Capture those cities, possibly even giving one back to the Celts as a goodwill gesture, while earning goodwill with the Japanese for joining in their war against Rome.

Can’t wait to try this out next time I play!
